1.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, according to the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus;

2.text: to Timothy, my beloved child: Grace, mercy, and peace [be with you] from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.text: I give thanks to God to whom I offer divine service as my forefathers did, and with a pure conscience. I always remember you in my petitions, night and day,

4.text: longing to see you, remembering your tears, so that I may be filled with joy.

5.text: I also remember your sincere faith which first dwelt in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice. I am convinced [that it dwells] in you also!

6.text: For this reason, I am reminding you to rekindle the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands.

7.text: For God did not give us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and self-control.

8.text: Therefore, do not be ashamed to be a witness of our Lord or ashamed of me his prisoner. Share in my tribulations for the sake of the Good News, by the power of God.

9.text: He saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal.

10.text: This has now been revealed by the manifestation of our Savior Jesus Christ who abolished death and brought to light [both] life and immortality through the Good News.

11.text: For this, I was appointed as a herald, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles.

12.text: That is why I am suffering as I am! Yet I am not ashamed, because I know him in whom I have believed and I am persuaded that he is able to protect what I have committed to him until that Day.

13.text: Hold to the pattern of sound teachings which you have heard from me, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.

14.text: With the help of the Holy Spirit who dwells in us, guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you.

15.text: As you know, all who are in Asia have turned away from me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.

16.text: May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my imprisonment.

17.text: When he was in Rome, he searched very hard for me and he found me!

18.text: May the Lord grant him to find the Lordâ€™s mercy in that Day, for he served [me] at Ephesus in many ways, as you know very well.
